se.kth.inda.indaprojekt.engine

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.kth.inda.indaprojekt.engine.Level

  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    A Level contains a number of WorldObjects and may progress the level forward if told so by moving objects, checking collisions, etc. Extreme bugs may arise if multiple threads are calling the levelTick()
    Author:
    David Masko

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level(Dimension size)
        Creates an new Level with the given size. The size cannot be changed once the Level has been created. A Level is a plain rectangular open shape.
        Parameters:
        size - The Size of the Level.

    • Method Detail

      • addWorldObject

        public boolean addWorldObject(WorldObject wo)
        Tags the the given WorldObject to be added into the Level upon the next gameTick. The WorldObject is only added to the Level before a Level tick in order to keep it thread safe.
        Parameters:
        wo - WorldObject to be added.
        Returns:
        true if the WorldObject isn't present in the Level, false otherwise.

      • removeWorldObject

        public void removeWorldObject(WorldObject wo)
        Tags the the given WorldObject to be removed from the Level upon the next gameTick. The WorldObject is only removed fron the Level before a Level tick in order to keep it thread safe.
        Parameters:
        wo - WorldObject to be removed

      • getWorldObjects

        public WorldObject[] getWorldObjects(boolean sortedByDrawPriority)
        Returns all WorldObjects in the level. SORT NOT YET IMPLEMENTED
        Parameters:
        sortedByDrawPriority - If the WorldOjects should be sorted by drawPriority.
        Returns:
        All WorldObjects in the Level.

      • levelTick

        public void levelTick()
        Makes the level execute events for one game tick. This is initiated by adding and removing all tagged WorldObjects followed by applying all defined tick effects on all WorldObjects, check for collision and apply onImpactEffects for all colliding Projectiles. NOTE: levelTick is NOT thread-safe and should NOT be called by multiple threads. This may have a catastrophic effects on the Level - a crash or strange bugs may occur.

      • getState

        public LevelState getState()
        The current state of this Level.
        Returns:
        the current LevelState of this Level.

      • getSize

        public Dimension getSize()
        The Size of the Level.
        Returns:
        The Size of the Level.

        public Wizard[] getWizards()
        Returns:
